Utility function to fetch while bypassing the cache, and with some default options.


11const cfFetch = (uri, options) => {


12    return fetch(uri, {


13        credentials: 'same-origin',


14        ...options,


15    });


16}


17


This api object provides some utility methods we use to fetch and push stuff to and from the Codeframe internal API.


20const api = {


21    get: path => cfFetch(`/api${path}`, {


22        method: 'GET',


23    }),


24    post: (path, body) => cfFetch(`/api${path}`, {


25        method: 'POST',


26        body: body,


27    }),


28    errlog: e => console.error(`Codeframe API error:\n\t${e}`),


29}


30


31const now = () => new Date().getTime();


32


Debounce coalesces multiple calls to the same function in a short period of time into one call, by cancelling subsequent calls within a given timeframe.


36const debounce = (fn, delayMillis) => {


37    let lastRun = 0;


38    let to = null;


39    return (...args) => {


40        clearTimeout(to);


41        const dfn = () => {


42            lastRun = now();


43            fn(...args);


44        }


45        if (now() - lastRun > delayMillis) {


46            dfn()


47        } else {


48            to = setTimeout(dfn, delayMillis);


49        }


50    }


51}


52


The PreviewPane  is the half-screen pane that shows a preview of the rendered Codeframe, alongside the URL and refresh buttons.


55class PreviewPane extends StyledComponent {

Percentage of the editor size that the preview pane takes up.

60


We create an iframe manually and insert it into the component DOM, so as to avoid the iframe being re-fetched and re-rendered every time the preview pane is rendered.


64        this.iframe = document.createElement('iframe');


65        this.iframe.setAttribute('frameborder', 0);

165


166    selectInput(evt) {


167        evt.target.select();


168        gevent('preview', 'selecturl');


169    }


170


171    handleRefresh() {


Force-refreshing the preview works by clearing the "last url" fetched, so it looks like the same URL is a new URL on next render.


174        this._lastURL = '';


175        this.render();


176        gevent('preview', 'refresh');


177    }


178


179    safelySetIframeURL(url) {


If the iframe already has content, we want to replace its uri; if not, we want to give it a uri. This takes care of this logic.


182        if (this._lastURL !== url) {




If we simply assign to iframe.src property here, it adds an entry to the parent page's back/forward history, which we don't want. We only want to add to src if the iframe does not already have a page loaded (i.e. when contentWindow is null).


186            if (this.iframe.contentWindow) {


187                this.iframe.contentWindow.location.replace(url);


188            } else {


189                this.iframe.src = url;


190            }


191            this._lastURL = url;


192        }


193    }


194


195    compose(data) {


If we're not rendering from a saved Codeframe from the server but instead rendering a "live" preview, generate a data URI instead and point the iframe to that. Otherwise, just use the URL to the saved preview.


199        let url = '';


200        if (data.liveRenderMarkup === null) {


201            url = `${window.location.origin}/f/${data.htmlFrameHash}/${data.jsFrameHash}.html`;


202        } else {


203            url = 'data:text/html,' + encodeURIComponent(data.liveRenderMarkup);


204        }


205        this.safelySetIframeURL(url);


206


We compare the new URL to the old URL here, to see whether we need to reset the src attribute on the iframe. If it's unchanged, we leave the iframe alone.


209        return jdom`<div class="previewPanel" style="width:${this.paneWidth}%">


210            ${data.liveRenderMarkup === null ? (


211                jdom`<div class="topBar">


212                    <div class="fixed button inputContainer">


213                        <input value="${url}" onfocus="${this.selectInput}" />


214                    </div>


215                    <button class="button refreshButton" title="Refresh preview"


216                        onclick="${this.handleRefresh}">↻</button>


217                    <a class="button previewButton" title="Open preview in new tab"


218                        target="_blank" href="${url}">Preview</a>


219                </div>`


220            ) : (


221                jdom`<div class="topBar">


222                    <div class="unsavedWarning">


223                        tap


224                        <div class="fixed inline button">Save ${'&'} Reload</div>


225                        to share <span class="mobile-hidden">→</span>


226                    </div>


227                </div>`


228            )}


229            ${this.iframe}


230        </div>`;


231    }


232


233}


234


Shorthand function that inserts a script tag with a given source and returns a promise that resolves when the script is loaded and evaluated. We use this as a minimal module loader to bootstrap loading of editor modules.


238const loadScript = url => {


239    const tag = document.createElement('script');


240    tag.src = url;


241    tag.async = true;


242    return new Promise((res, _rej) => {


243        tag.addEventListener('load', res);


244        document.body.appendChild(tag);


245    });


246}


247


Editor implementations


249




Codeframe uses multiple different editor backends (EditorCore implementations) to implement the actual code editor part of Codeframe. This is because...  1. It reduces reliance on one particular third-party editor. 2. It creates an interface under which new editor backends can be added / experimented with. 3. Different editor backends are best suited for different clients.  We currently use two backends, Visual Studio Code's Monaco editor, and CodeMirror, which powers Glitch, Chrome DevTools, and more.


259




Monaco-based implementation of EditorCore


261class MonacoEditor {


262


263    constructor(callback) {


264        this.mode = 'html';


265


Frames are temporary storage of loaded / saved Codeframe source files before the editor itself has been loaded and initialized.


268        this.frames = {


269            html: '',


270            javascript: ``,


271        }


Monaco's core data structure backing each source file in the editor is the "model". Each model represents and holds edit data, history, etc. for one file. We keep track of two and swap between them in one editor instance.


275        this.models = {


276            html: null,


277            javascript: null,


278        }


279


280        this.container = document.createElement('div');


281        this.container.classList.add('editorContainer');


282        this.monacoEditor = null;


283


See setValue() to see why this exists.


285        this._beingSetProgrammatically = false;


286


Load the core editor module loader, and begin bootstrapping the Monaco editor loading process.


289        loadScript('https://unpkg.com/monaco-editor/min/vs/loader.js').then(() => this._loadEditor(callback));


290    }


291


Loads the rest of the Monaco editor source code and initializes the editor.


293    _loadEditor(callback) {


294        require.config({


295            paths: {


296                vs: 'https://unpkg.com/monaco-editor/min/vs',


297            },


298        });


299        require(['vs/editor/editor.main'], () => {


Initialize models for both files


301            this.models.html = monaco.editor.createModel(this.frames.html, 'html');


302            this.models.javascript = monaco.editor.createModel(this.frames.javascript, 'javascript');


303


Define a custom theme


305            monaco.editor.defineTheme('cf-default', {


306                base: 'vs',


307                inherit: true,


308                rules: [


309                    {token: '', foreground: '000000', background: 'ffffff'},


310                    {token: 'comment', foreground: '888888', fontStyle: 'italic'},


311


Javascript-related highlights


313                    {token: 'keyword', foreground: '3436bb', fontStyle: 'bold'},


314                    {token: 'type', foreground: '038c6e'},


315                    {token: 'string', foreground: 'b31515'},


316                    {token: 'number', foreground: 'ec6a40'},


317


HTML/CSS-related highlights


319                    {token: 'tag', foreground: '038c6e'},


320                    {token: 'attribute.name', foreground: 'e40132'},


321                    {token: 'attribute.value.html', foreground: '3436bb'},


322                ],


323                colors: {


324                    'editor.background': '#ffffff',


325                    'editor.lineHighlightBorder': '#f8f8f8',

328                    'editorLineNumber.activeForeground': '#333333',


329                    'editorIndentGuide.background': '#ffffff',


330                    'editorIndentGuide.activeBackground': '#ffffff',


331                },


332            });


333            monaco.editor.setTheme('cf-default');


334


Create one editor instance, in which we can swap between the two source file models being edited.


337            this.monacoEditor = monaco.editor.create(this.container, {


338                fontFamily: "'Menlo', 'Monaco', monospace",


339            });


340            this.monacoEditor.setModel(this.models[this.mode]);


341


When the editor loads, bring the focus to it unless there is another element with focus.


344            if (document.activeElement === null || document.activeElement === document.body) {


345                this.monacoEditor.focus();


346            }


347


348            callback();


349        });

351


The following interface methods are shared between all EditorCore implementations


353


354    getValue(mode = this.mode) {


355        if (this.ready()) {


356            return this.models[mode].getValue();


357        } else {


358            return this.frames[mode];


359        }


360    }


361


362    setValue(value, mode = this.mode) {


363        if (this.ready()) {


364            if (this.models[mode].getValue() !== value) {


Monaco doesn't have the ability to distinguish between changes to editor content that happens because of user-initiated edits vs. programmatic edits using setValue(). Since we only want to fire change event handlers for the former kind of change, we keep track of the "is this a programmatic change" state in this variable.


370                this._beingSetProgrammatically = true;


371                this.models[mode].setValue(value);


372                this._beingSetProgrammatically = false;


373            }


374        } else {


375            this.frames[mode] = value;


376        }


377    }


378


379    getMode() {


380        return this.mode;


381    }


382


383    setMode(mode) {


384        this.mode = mode;


385        this.monacoEditor.setModel(this.models[mode]);


386    }


387


388    addChangeHandler(handler) {


389        if (this.ready()) {


390            const userChangeHandler = () => {


391                if (!this._beingSetProgrammatically) {


392                    handler();


393                }


394            }


In Monaco, there isn't change events in the editor, but instead change events in the models, which we listen for.


397            this.models.html.onDidChangeContent(userChangeHandler);


398            this.models.javascript.onDidChangeContent(userChangeHandler);


399        }


400    }


401


402    getContainer() {


403        return this.container;


404    }


405


406    resize() {


407        if (this.ready()) {


408            this.monacoEditor.layout();


409        }


410    }


411


412    ready() {


413        return this.monacoEditor !== null;


414    }


415


416}

CodeMirror-based implementation of EditorCore, which is enabled on mobile browsers because Monaco is not mobile browser-compatible. This implementation is also slightly faster on slower networks.


421class CodeMirrorEditor {


422


423    constructor(callback) {


424        this.mode = 'html';


425


426        this.frames = {


427            html: '',


428            javascript: ``,


429        }


The Document is CodeMirror's data structure for storing file and editor contents, edit history, etc. To swap between files / modes, we swap between these two documents.


433        this.documents = {


434            html: null,


435            javascript: null,


436        }


437


438        this.container = document.createElement('div');


439        this.container.classList.add('editorContainer');


440        this.codeMirrorEditor = null;


441


This bootstraps the loading process for the CodeMirror editor.


443        this._loadEditor(callback);


444    }


445


446    async _loadEditor(callback) {


We fix the version number here because CM 6 is going to have breaking API changes, and it's unclear at time of writing if that'll be released under the same package.


450        const EDITOR_SCRIPT_ROOT = 'https://unpkg.com/codemirror@5';


451        const EDITOR_SCRIPT_SRC = EDITOR_SCRIPT_ROOT + '/lib/codemirror.js';


452        const LANG_SCRIPT_SRC = [


453            'javascript',


xml and css are dependencies of htmlmixed, the standalone (not embedded) HTML language mode for CM.


456            'xml',


457            'css',


458            'htmlmixed',


459        ].map(mode => `${EDITOR_SCRIPT_ROOT}/mode/${mode}/${mode}.js`);


460        const AUX_SRC = [


461            'edit/closetag.js',


462            'edit/closebrackets.js',


463        ].map(path => `${EDITOR_SCRIPT_ROOT}/addon/${path}`);


464


CodeMirror has an accompanying stylesheet. We load this manually here.


466        const styleLink = document.createElement('link');


467        styleLink.rel = 'stylesheet';


468        styleLink.href = EDITOR_SCRIPT_ROOT + '/lib/codemirror.css';


469        document.head.appendChild(styleLink);


470


These must load in this order -- language modes must load after the core editor is loaded, but once the core editor is loaded, everything else can load in parallel.


474        await loadScript(EDITOR_SCRIPT_SRC);


475        await Promise.all([


476            ...LANG_SCRIPT_SRC,


477            ...AUX_SRC,


478        ].map(loadScript));


479


480        this.documents.html = CodeMirror.Doc(this.frames.html, 'htmlmixed');


481        this.documents.javascript = CodeMirror.Doc(this.frames.javascript, 'javascript');


482


483        this.codeMirrorEditor = CodeMirror(this.container, {


484            indentUnit: 4,


485            tabSize: 4,


486            lineWrapping: false,


487            lineNumbers: true,


488            indentWithTabs: true,


489


490            // provided by edit/closetag.js


491            autoCloseTags: true,


492


493            // provided by edit/closebrackets.js


494            autoCloseBrackets: true,


495        });


We swap the document in after instantiation rather than in creation, because the latter option strips the document of its language mode. This seems like a poorly documented behavior of CM.


499        this.codeMirrorEditor.swapDoc(this.documents[this.mode]);


500


501        if (document.activeElement === null || document.activeElement === document.body) {


502            this.codeMirrorEditor.focus();


503        }


504


505        callback();


506    }


507


508    getValue(mode = this.mode) {


509        if (this.ready()) {


510            return this.documents[mode].getValue();


511        } else {


512            return this.frames[mode];


513        }


514    }


515


516    setValue(value, mode = this.mode) {


517        if (this.ready()) {


518            if (this.documents[mode].getValue() !== value) {


519                this.documents[mode].setValue(value);


520            }


521        } else {


522            this.frames[mode] = value;


523        }


524    }


525


526    getMode() {


527        return this.mode;


528    }


529


530    setMode(mode) {


531        this.mode = mode;


532        if (this.ready()) {


533            this.codeMirrorEditor.swapDoc(this.documents[mode]);


534        }


535    }


536


537    addChangeHandler(handler) {


538        if (this.ready()) {


539            this.codeMirrorEditor.on('changes', (_, changeEvent) => {


We want to avoid triggering change events not generated directly from user input. i.e. we don't want to hit change handlers when we reload or reroute.


543                if (changeEvent[0].origin !== 'setValue') {


544                    handler();


545                }


546            });


547        }


548    }


549


550    getContainer() {


551        return this.container;


552    }


553


554    resize() {


555        this.codeMirrorEditor.setSize();


556    }


557


558    ready() {


559        return this.codeMirrorEditor !== null;


560    }


561


562}

Depending on the client, pick the editor implementation that provides the best experience.


565const EditorCore = navigator.userAgent.match(/(Android|iPhone|iPad|iPod)/) ? CodeMirrorEditor : MonacoEditor;

The Editor component encapsulates the Monaco editor, all file state, and other state about the files the user is editing.


569class Editor extends StyledComponent {


570


571    init(frameRecord) {


Percentage of the editor size that the editor pane takes up.


573        this.paneWidth = 50;


574


Initial values for extra settings


576        this.settings = {




Is the config bar visible?


578            visible: false,




Is the as-you-type live reload enabled?


580            asYouTypeEnabled: true,


581        }


582


Frame hashes of the last-saved editor values, to see if we need to re-fetch frame file values when the route changes.


585        this._lastHash = '';


586        this.initEditorCore();


587


588        this.bind(frameRecord, data => {


589            this.fetchFrames(data);


590            this.render(data);


591        });


592


Any calls to resizeEditor should be debounced to 250ms. This is negligible to UX in fast modern laptops, but has a noticeable impact on UX for lower-end devices.


595        this.resizeEditor = debounce(this.resizeEditor.bind(this), 250);


596        window.addEventListener('resize', this.resizeEditor);


597


We create these two methods that are versions of switchMode bound to specific editing modes, for easier use later on in compose().


600        this.switchHTMLMode = this.switchMode.bind(this, 'html');


601        this.switchJSMode = this.switchMode.bind(this, 'javascript');


602        this.saveFrames = this.saveFrames.bind(this);


603


Bind other methods used as callbacks


605        this.toggleSettings = this.toggleSettings.bind(this);


606        this.toggleAsYouType = this.toggleAsYouType.bind(this);


607


Live-rendering (previewing unsaved changes) should be debounced, since we don't want to re-render the iframe with every keystroke, for example. But we leave an escape hatch with *Immediate for forced re-renders, etc.


611        this.liveRenderFramesImmediate = this.liveRenderFrames.bind(this);


612        this.liveRenderFrames = debounce(this.liveRenderFramesImmediate, 750);


613    }


614


615    remove() {


616        window.removeEventListener('resize', this.resizeEditor)


617    }


618


619    setWidth(width) {


620        this.paneWidth = width;


621        this.resizeEditor();


622        this.render();


623    }


624


625    fetchFrames(data) {


fetchFrames is in charge of (1) determining based on new data whether we need to re-fetch HTML and JS files for the current version of the Codeframe (or if we have it already) and making those requests and saving the results to the view state. We are careful here to first check if the frames we are looking to fetch aren't the ones already saved in the editor.


630        if (


631            data.htmlFrameHash + data.jsFrameHash !== this._lastHash


632            && data.htmlFrameHash


633        ) {


634            this._lastHash = data.htmlFrameHash + data.jsFrameHash;


635            api.get(`/frame/${data.htmlFrameHash}`).then(resp => {


636                return resp.text();


637            }).then(result => {


This checks against a race bug, where more recent "live" edits have been made since we began to fetch frames.


640                if (this.record.get('liveRenderMarkup') === null) {


641                    this.core.setValue(result, 'html');


642                }


643            }).catch(e => api.errlog(e));


644


645            api.get(`/frame/${data.jsFrameHash}`).then(resp => {


646                return resp.text();


647            }).then(result => {


This checks against a race bug. See above.


649                if (this.record.get('liveRenderMarkup') === null) {


650                    this.core.setValue(result, 'javascript');


651                }


652            }).catch(e => api.errlog(e));


653        }


654    }


655


Initialize the given editor implementation.


657    initEditorCore() {


658        this.core = new EditorCore(() => {


Here we populate potential prefilled values from the URL query strings, and force-live-render it into the preview to make those dirty changes visible without saving these examples to the server.


662            if (prefilledValues.html || prefilledValues.js) {


663                this.core.setValue(prefilledValues.html, 'html');


664                this.core.setValue(prefilledValues.js, 'javascript');


665                this.liveRenderFramesImmediate();


666            }


667


668            this.core.addChangeHandler(this.liveRenderFrames);


669


670            this.render();


671            this.resizeEditor();


672        });


673    }


674


675    resizeEditor() {


676        this.core.resize();


677    }


678


679    switchMode(mode) {


When we switch modes, we have to first save the value of the file being edited, then switch out the underlying file model.


682        this.core.setMode(mode);


683        this.render();


684        gevent('editor', 'switchmode', mode);


685    }


686


liveRenderFrames() is called when the editor content changes, to client-side refresh the iframe preview contents.


689    liveRenderFrames() {


690        if (!this.settings.asYouTypeEnabled) {


691            return;


692        }


693


694        const documentMarkup = `<!DOCTYPE html>


695<html>


696    <head>


697        <meta charset="utf-8"/>


698        <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width,initial-scale=1"/>


699        <title>Live Frame | Codeframe</title>


700    </head>


701    <body>


702        ${this.core.getValue('html')}


703        <script src="https://unpkg.com/torus-dom/dist/index.min.js"></script>


704        <script>${this.core.getValue('javascript')}</script>


705    </body>


706</html>`;


707


708        this.record.update({


709            liveRenderMarkup: documentMarkup,


710        });


711    }


712


713    toggleSettings() {


714        this.settings.visible = !this.settings.visible;


715        this.render();


The settings bar changes the editor view size, so we need to re-layout the editor after render.


718        this.resizeEditor();


719    }


720


721    toggleAsYouType() {


722        this.settings.asYouTypeEnabled = !this.settings.asYouTypeEnabled;


723        this.render();


In case there are any current dirty changes when this is toggled on...


725        if (this.settings.asYouTypeEnabled) {


726            this.liveRenderFramesImmediate();


727        }


728        gevent('editor', 'settings.asyoutype', this.settings.asYouTypeEnabled.toString());


729    }


730


saveFrames handles saving / persisting Codeframe files to the backend service, and returns a promise that resolves only once all frame files have been saved.


733    async saveFrames() {


734        const hashes = {


735            html: '',


736            js: '',


737        }


This is a nice way to make the function hang (not resolve its returned Promise) until all of its requests have resolved.


740        await Promise.all([


741            api.post('/frame/', this.core.getValue('html'))


742                .then(resp => resp.text())


743                .then(hash => hashes.html = hash)


744                .catch(e => api.errlog(e)),


745            api.post('/frame/', this.core.getValue('javascript'))


746                .then(resp => resp.text())


747                .then(hash => hashes.js = hash)


748                .catch(e => api.errlog(e)),


749        ]);


Once we've saved the current frames, open the new frames up in the preview pane by going to this route with the new frames.


752        const route = `/h/${hashes.html}/j/${hashes.js}/edit`;


753        if (window.location.pathname.startsWith(route)) {


754            this.record.update({


755                liveRenderMarkup: null,


756            });


757        } else {


758            router.go(route);


759        }


760        gevent('editor', 'save');


761    }


762


763    styles() {


764        return css`


765        height: 100%;


766        flex-grow: 1;


767        flex-shrink: 1;


768        overflow: hidden;


769        border-left: 2px solid var(--cf-black);


770        display: flex;


771        flex-direction: column;


772        @media (max-width: 750px) {


773            width: 100% !important;


774            height: 50% !important;


775            border-left: 0 !important;


776            border-top: 2px solid var(--cf-black);


777        }


778        .topBar {


779            display: flex;


780            flex-direction: row;


781            justify-content: space-between;


782            align-items: center;

784            border-bottom: 4px dotted var(--cf-black);


785            flex-shrink: 0;

787            overflow-x: auto;


788            .embedded & {


789                background: var(--cf-background);


790            }


791        }

793            display: flex;


794            flex-direction: row;


795            align-items: center;


796        }

798            font-size: .75rem;


799        }

801            border: 0;


802            background: transparent;


803            height: unset;


804            width: unset;

806            &::after {


807                display: none;


808            }


809        }


810        .editorContainer,

813            /* dummy size, flex will resize


814             * but CodeMirror needs a set size */


815            height: 300px;

820            display: flex;


821            flex-direction: row;


822            justify-content: center;


823            align-items: center;


824            color: #555;


825            em {


826                display: block;


827            }


828        }


829        .CodeMirror {


830            height: 100%;

832            font-size: 12px;


833            line-height: 1.5em;


834            &-gutters {


835                background: #fff;


836                border-right: 0;

849                color: #888;

853                font-weight: bold;


854            }

856                color: #038c6e;


857            }

860                color: #b31515;


861            }

863                color: #ec6140;


864            }

866                color: #038c6e;


867            }

869                color: #e40132;


870            }


871        }


872        `;


873    }


874


875    compose() {


876        const mode = this.core.getMode();


877


878        return jdom`<div class="editor" style="width:${this.paneWidth}%">


879            <div class="topBar">


880                <div class="buttonGroup">


881                    <button


882                        class="button ${mode === 'html' ? 'active' : ''} tab-html"


883                        title="Switch to HTML editor"


884                        onclick="${this.switchHTMLMode}">


885                        HTML


886                    </button>


887                    <button


888                        class="button ${mode === 'javascript' ? 'active' : ''} tab-js"


889                        title="Switch to JavaScript editor"


890                        onclick="${this.switchJSMode}">


891                        JavaScript


892                    </button>


893                </div>


894                <div class="buttonGroup">


895                    <button class="button ${this.settings.visible ? 'active' : ''}" title="Show additional settings"


896                        onclick="${this.toggleSettings}">...</button>


897                    <button class="button" title="Save Codeframe and reload preview"


898                        onclick="${this.saveFrames}">Save ${'&'} Reload</button>


899                </div>


900            </div>


901            ${this.settings.visible ? (


902                jdom`<div class="topBar">


903                    <button class="button ${this.settings.asYouTypeEnabled ? 'active' : ''}"


904                        title="Turn on or off live-reloading as you type"


905                        onclick="${this.toggleAsYouType}">


906                        Reload as you type


907                        ${this.settings.asYouTypeEnabled ? '(on)' : '(off)'}


908                    </button>


909                </div>`


910            ) : null}


911            ${this.core.ready() ? this.core.getContainer() : (


If the editor is not yet available (is still loading), show a placeholder bit of text.


914                jdom`<div class="ready"><em>Getting your editor ready...</em></div>`


915            )}


916        </div>`;


917    }


918


919}


920


The Workspace component is the "Codeframe editor". That is to say, this is the component that wraps everything into a neat, interactive page and is the backbone of the Codeframe editing experience.


924class Workspace extends StyledComponent {


925


926    init(frameRecord) {


The left/right panes are split 50/50 between its two panes.


928        this.paneSplit = 50;


929        this.preview = new PreviewPane(frameRecord);


930        this.editor = new Editor(frameRecord);


931


932        this.bind(frameRecord, data => this.render(data));


933


this.grabDragging represents whether there is currently a drag-to-resize-panes interaction happening.


936        this.grabDragging = false;


937        this.handleGrabMousedown = this.handleGrabMousedown.bind(this);


938        this.handleGrabMousemove = this.handleGrabMousemove.bind(this);


939        this.handleGrabMouseup = this.handleGrabMouseup.bind(this);


940


941        window.addEventListener('beforeunload', evt => {


942            if (this.record.get('liveRenderMarkup') !== null) {


943                evt.returnValue = 'You have unsaved changes to your Codeframe. Are you sure you want to leave?';


944            }


945        });


946    }


947


Shortcut method to set the sizes of children components, given one split percentage.


950    setPaneWidth(width) {




These cases implement "snapping" of panes to 0, 50, 100% increments, with 1% buffer around each snap point.


953        if (width < 1) {


954            width = 0;


955        } else if (width > 99) {


956            width = 100;


957        } else if (width > 49 && width < 51) {


958            width = 50;


959        }


960


961        this.paneSplit = width;


962        this.preview.setWidth(width);


963        this.editor.setWidth(100 - width);


964        this.render();


965    }


966


What follows are mouse/pointer event handlers to make resizing a smooth experience.


969


970    handleGrabMousedown() {


971        this.grabDragging = true;


972        this.render();


973    }


974


975    handleGrabMousemove(evt) {


976        if (this.grabDragging) {


977            if (!evt.defaultPrevented) {


978                evt.preventDefault();


979            }


If the event is a touch event, get the clientX of the first touch point, not the whole event.


982            if (evt.touches) {


983                evt = evt.touches[0];


984            }


985            this.setPaneWidth(evt.clientX / window.innerWidth * 100);


986        }


987    }


988


989    handleGrabMouseup() {


990        this.grabDragging = false;


991        this.render();


992        gevent('workspace', 'resize', 'editor', this.paneSplit);


993    }


994


995    styles() {


996        return css`


997        width: 100%;


998        height: 100%;


999        display: flex;


1000        flex-direction: column;


1001        header {


1002            display: flex;


1003            flex-direction: row;


1004            justify-content: space-between;


1005            align-items: center;


1006            flex-shrink: 0;


1007            padding: 4px;


1008            background: var(--cf-background);


1009            border-bottom: 4px solid var(--cf-black);


1010        }


1011        &.embedded header {


1012            display: none;


1013        }


1014        nav {


1015            display: flex;


1016            flex-direction: row;


1017            flex-shrink: 1;


1018            overflow-x: auto;


1019        }


1020        main {


1021            display: flex;


1022            flex-direction: row;


1023            justify-content: space-between;


1024            align-items: flex-start;


1025            flex-grow: 1;


1026            flex-shrink: 1;


1027            overflow: hidden;


1028            position: relative;


1029            height: 100%;


1030            @media (max-width: 750px) {


1031                flex-direction: column !important;


1032            }


1033        }


1034        .button {


1035            white-space: nowrap;


1036        }


1037        .newButton {


1038            color: var(--cf-accent);


1039        }


1040        .grabHandle {


1041            position: absolute;


1042            top: 50%;


1043            left: 0;


1044            transform: translate(-50%, -50%);


1045            border-radius: 4px;


1046            width: 8px;


1047            height: 56px;


1048            background: #fff;


1049            border: 3px solid var(--cf-black);


1050            cursor: ew-resize;


1051            z-index: 2000;


1052            &:hover {


1053                background: var(--cf-background);


1054            }


1055            &:active {


1056                background: var(--cf-accent);


1057            }


1058        }


1059        .grabHandleShadow {


1060            background: rgba(0, 0, 0, .1);


1061            position: absolute;


1062            top: 0;


1063            left: 0;


1064            right: 0;


1065            bottom: 0;


1066            z-index: 1000;


1067            transition: opacity .3s;


1068            cursor: ew-resize;


1069            &.hidden {


1070                opacity: 0;


1071                pointer-events: none;


1072            }


1073        }


1074        .fullButton {


1075            display: none;


1076        }


1077        &.embedded .fullButton {


1078            display: block;


1079            position: absolute;


1080            top: unset;


1081            left: unset;


1082            bottom: 2px;


1083            right: 6px;


1084            font-size: .75em;


1085            z-index: 100;


1086        }


1087        `;


1088    }


1089


1090    compose() {


1091        return jdom`


1092        <div class="workspace ${window.frameElement === null ? '' : 'embedded'}"


1093            ontouchmove="${this.grabDragging ? this.handleGrabMousemove : ''}"


1094            ontouchend="${this.grabDragging ? this.handleGrabMouseup : ''}"


1095            onmousemove="${this.grabDragging ? this.handleGrabMousemove : ''}"


1096            onmouseup="${this.grabDragging ? this.handleGrabMouseup : ''}">


1097            <header>


1098                <div class="logo">


1099                    <a class="button" href="/">Codeframe</a>


1100                </div>


1101                <nav>


1102                    <a class="button newButton" href="/new?from=editor">


1103                        + New <span class="mobile-hidden">Codeframe</span>


1104                    </a>


1105                    <a class="button tiny-hidden" href="https://twitter.com/thesephist" target="_blank">


1106                        <span class="mobile-hidden">Made by</span> @thesephist


1107                    </a>


1108                    <a class="button" href="https://github.com/thesephist/codeframe" target="_blank">


1109                        <span class="mobile-hidden">View Source on</span> GitHub


1110                    </a>


1111                </nav>


1112            </header>


1113            <main>


1114                ${this.preview.node}


1115                ${this.editor.node}


1116                <a class="button fullButton"


1117                    title="Open this editor in a new tab"


1118                    target="_blank"


1119                    href="${window.location.href}">


1120                    Open in new tab


1121                </a>


1122                <div class="grabHandleShadow ${this.grabDragging ? '' : 'hidden'}"></div>


1123                <div


1124                    title="Resize editor panes"


1125                    class="grabHandle mobile-hidden"


1126                    style="left:${this.paneSplit}%"


1127                    ontouchstart="${this.handleGrabMousedown}"


1128                    onmousedown="${this.handleGrabMousedown}">


1129                </div>


1130            </main>


1131        </div>`;


1132    }


1133


1134}


1135


The App component simply wraps around the Workspace to provide routing and a container for the workspace.


1138class App extends StyledComponent {


1139


1140    init(router) {


This frameRecord becomes the view model for most views in the editor.


1143        this.frameRecord = new Record({


1144            htmlFrameHash: '',


1145            jsFrameHash: '',


1146            liveRenderMarkup: null,


1147        });


1148        this.workspace = new Workspace(this.frameRecord);


1149


Routing logic.


1151        this.bind(router, ([name, params]) => {


1152            switch (name) {


1153                case 'edit':


1154                    this.frameRecord.update({


1155                        htmlFrameHash: params.htmlFrameHash,


1156                        jsFrameHash: params.jsFrameHash,


1157                        liveRenderMarkup: null,


1158                    });


1159                    break;


1160                case 'welcome':


This is a predetermined URL that points to the welcome Codeframe.


1162                    router.go('/h/34257cad6ac3/j/e3b0c44298fc/edit', {replace: true});


1163                    break;


1164                default:


1165                    {


If there are prefilled HTML and JavaScript values provided provided in the query string, parse and save it for later when the editor loads.


1169                        const searchPart = window.location.search.substr(1);


1170                        if (searchPart) {


1171                            for (const pair of searchPart.split('&')) {


1172                                const idx = pair.indexOf('=');


1173                                const langPart = pair.substr(0, idx);


1174                                if (langPart in prefilledValues) {


1175                                    prefilledValues[langPart] = decodeURIComponent(pair.substr(idx + 1));


1176                                }


1177                            }


1178                        }


1179                    }


When we redirect some URL right on page load, we want that new URL to replace the old, given URL value, not append a new history entry. So replace the history entry, not append. In this case, we redirect to the URL of an empty Codeframe


1184                    router.go(`/h/e3b0c44298fc/j/e3b0c44298fc/edit`, {replace: true});


1185                    break;


1186            }


1187        })


1188    }


1189


1190    styles() {


1191        return css`


1192        width: 100%;


1193        height: 100vh;


1194        display: flex;


1195        flex-direction: column;


1196        overflow: hidden;


1197        `;


1198    }


1199


1200    compose() {


1201        return jdom`<div id="root">


1202            ${this.workspace.node}


1203        </div>`;


1204    }


1205


1206}


1207


Used to save some global values for when the URL contains a pre-populated code sample.


1210const prefilledValues = {


1211    html: '',


1212    js: '',


1213}


1214


1215const router = new Router({


1216    edit: '/h/:htmlFrameHash/j/:jsFrameHash/edit',


1217    welcome: '/welcome',


1218    default: '/new',


1219});


1220


Create a new instance of the editor app and mount it to the DOM.


1222const app = new App(router);


1223document.body.appendChild(app.node);


1224


Since the editor is a full-window app, we don't want any overflows to make the app unnecessary scrollable beyond its viewport.


1227document.body.style.overflow = 'hidden';


1228
